text: Picked this upper as a growler fill earlier today. Pours into a two finger nearly bleached-white head that laces the glass. Tree Houses notes lemon-lime up front; however, Im getting a ton of pineapple notes here. The optics are cloudy. The bitterness and mouthfeel are spot-on. If I had it on tap at my house Id never leave.
Hazy opaque gold pour, huge head, huge lace. Tropical fruit aroma, quite dank, resinous. Big time hops up front, dank, catty, tropical fruit, orange, pine. Mouthfeel is spot on, light dank finish.

16 oz can. Pours a hazy, glowing golden orange color and topped by a small off white layer of foam that settles in quickly to a thin film and leaves sudsy streaks of lace around the glass. The aroma is very tropical fruit forward showing notes of juicy orange, tangerine, peach, and mango along with some floral and dank hop characters over a sweet bready malt base. The flavor follows suit and shows more of the juicy tropical fruits with orange, tangerine, pineapple, and peach most prominent to go with the soft bready malts and ample citrus and resinous hop bitterness on the backend. Medium bodied and almost pillowy soft on the palate with average carbonation that leads to a bitter sweet and juicy tropical fruit finish. Really well done IPA with that signature Tree House mouthfeel to it. Tasty stuff and another stellar IPA from the guys at Tree House.

(Can kindly shared by Flavio, in a queue at Mikkeller and Friends Bottle Shop) ~1mo at drinking. Shamelessly consumed from a can in a queue, looked a hazy medium orange peering through the top though! Aroma was big sticky resinous fruit, pineapple, ripe mango, orange rind, citrus oils, leafy, dank, touch of pine. Flavour is fruity but balances juice with big leafy, resinous hop cone character while keeping bitterness rather low. Notes of pineapple, mandarin, fresh pine, mango, leafy, intense, pretty dry overall. Medium-full mouthfeel, average carb. Even from a rather improvised serving in a bottle purchase queue, this beer made a big impression.

Pours hazy pear into a shaker. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Mango, peach and pineapple aromas. Sharp with sweet marshmallow and mango upfront turning to pineapple before the dry hot resin finish.
Amazing beer. Opaque in the glass. Amazing fruity aroma. Mouth feel is silky smooth. This beer explodes with flavor and is smooth from start to finish.

Data puszkowania 28.03.2017. Uff w końcu świeża IPA z USA. Jak to wygląda po nalaniu! Mętne, piana nabita i długo utrzymująca się. Aromat ananasowo-cytrusowy, raczej więcej tropikòw. Gładziutki, smukły, wspaniały sok tropikalno-cytusowy, gdzieś tam też pęta się żywica. Cudnie wytrawne. Troszkę lepiej niż Stigbergets GBG Week 16, ale w tę deseń. Świetna IPA.

A hazy yellow color with a two finger white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and lemon. A bitter, citrusy, and piney taste. A good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Two cans one 5 weeks old the other two weeks old. A bit more bitter than Julius, some lovely dank going on, with a lighter, fluffier body - smoothyesque.

Barwa jak sok pomarańczowy. Aromat cytrusowo-żywiczny, lekko tropikalny, ale bardziej w stronę cytrusowego. Pod koniec czuć niewielkie utlenienie. W smaku goryczka raczej łagodna, tekstura kremowa, aksamitna, wysoce pijalne, wytrawne. Po ogrzaniu lekka goryczka - w miarę długo utrzymująca się. Podsumowując ciało i wygląd to totalna NEPIA - pół do klasy wyżej niż GBG. Aromat trudny do ogarnięcia, mając na uwadze chmielenie Galaxy. Powiem tak, rozpatrując to pod kątem klimatów cytrusowo-żywicznych jest bardzo dobrze - klasa światowa. Jak ktoś oczekuje masy owoców tropikalnych i tego typu doznań, jak to ma miejsce w 90% NEIPa dostępnych na rynku, to się może zawieść. Na pewno solidna NEIPA, wytrawna z dużą dawką owoców cytrusowych - bardziej zorientowanych w kierunku pomarańczy/mandarynek.

Tasted from can. Pours a murky yellow with white head. Robust fruity aroma with orange peel, lemon, pineapple. Pretty heavily bitter. Flavors of citrus with some pine and resin on finish. Excellent tasting bitter IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this from a pour at the brewery. First thing you notice is how hazy and dank it is, it looks like grapefruit juice more than beer. Very unfiltered and gnarly in a good way. It smells wonderful, floral, piney. The taste is a lupilous haze of fruity hops with light drizzles of bitterness, very drinkable and delicate. Overall, it went down easy, left a strong impression, and left you begging for more. Hope to get some cans of this one next time! Good for killing time while everyone in line behind you tries to buy your cans cause they just ran out all the while you are missing your wonderful angel.

16 oz can shared by voodoofishusf75. Pours a hazy golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have more dank citrus and tropical fruit, pale malts, more dry bitterness than fruit juice, this one is a bit more up my alley.

Tree House Green. Que bela breja! Cítrica, amargor curto. Sensacional! 4.5/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at Travis birthday bash. This deserves its status because it is just delicious. The hops pop perfectly with mango and pineapple. More tropical fruit plus citrus. Malts enhance evetything. So good.
16oz can thanks to Steve. Pale golden pour with hazy body. Small airy head. Big dank hoppy aroma, sweet caramel malts. Taste continues, perfectly blended hops and malt. Just nice all the way through.

Une bière blonde un peu pâle, avec un bonne carbonatation, ainsi quune apparence bien voilée. Nez explosif de pamplemousses et doranges, mettant bien en vedette le houblon Galaxy, que que lon retrouve franchement très bien au sein de cette bière. En bouche, on retrouve encore ce goût dagrumes qui est franchement bien présent. Je goûte beaucoup les clémentines, avec un gout bien agrumé et bien sucré. On note après les premières gorgées une certaine amertume que jaime bien, qui vient contrebalancé un houblon Galaxy décidément bien présent en bouche et qui vient donner beaucoup déquilibre à la Green. Au final cest très bien fait, une IPA qui a tout ce quun amateur de houblon recherche.

Can at home. Hazy golden yellow with a one finger thick white head that leaves quite a lot of lacing. Aroma is pineapple and lots of citrus. Taste is pineapple, mango, grapefruit, citrus and grass. Great one!
Can. Hazy yellow colour with white head. Tropical fruits, peach aroma. Sweet, tropical fruits, peach, citric taste. Medium body.

Beer 110000 was the winner in a head to head between two top rated IPAs...Focal Banger at #7 and Green at #14. FB was a lighter yellow orange, more clear than the murky orange Green but with the floaties (didnt drink out of the can). FB has a pungent dank fruity nose...grapefruit lime and tropical fruit but the dankness in the nose and flavor wins it. Green was pleasantly fruity, soft palate, little bitterness. A one trick pony, but still pleasant if overrated IN THE TOP 15.

3.5 month old can. Opaque peach color with off-white head. Aroma is quite subdued, just some generic hops. Taste starts fruity with a hint of peach sweetness but gets quickly bitter and resiny. Medium plus body, nice carbonation. Overall its still really good but I think its already past its prime.
Can from the brewery, fresh off the line. This is a great beer, the tree house haze and big hop aroma.
Very good beer. Could drink this one daily. Treehouse has done well. This is one of their good ones.

Can [from trade with desp59, huge thanks!] @ home. Murky yellow color, full sized, lightly creamy, white to off-white head that lasts for quite a while. Aroma is super fresh tropical fruits, tropical fruit hop, grassy. Tastes the same: hops, hops hops, tropical fruit, pineapple, nectarines, soft fruit hop bitter finish but the immense amount of fruity hops make it almost sweet as well, the soft bitters just barely prevail. Soft mouthfeel, medium body, soft carbonation. Lovely IPA full of tropical fruit hop flavors. Awesome!

Can: Thank you kindly mister Matt! Served in my holy Chouffe glass:
Seriously beautiful murky even yellow body with a beautiful snowy white head! The start is good!
When opening the can the aroma immediately hit the nostrils!
Again a massive fruity and floral aroma! Absolutely right on Tree House being hyped! So much fruit, flowers and some hop going on! Happiness for the nose, mind and heart.
Flavour is very fruity, quite mellowy yet strong and very present! Lot of hop and IPA fruits! Floral flowers and such and some bitters. Alcohol voming through a bit more than with the 29 (curiosity: twenty nine) but no worries, it doesnt ruin the beer at all!
Aftertaste is bitter, hoppy, fruity, floral and a bit herbal...
Low to medium carbo, creamy mouthfeel and more than medium bodied!
This is (again) some tasty shit (from Tree House)! Very well done!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Piney,fruity,graccy and some floral notes on the nose very rich aroma. golden yellow hazy, off white head. fruits, citrus herbs, and some grass light malts generaly very hoppy but sweet flavor, rich mouthfeel , substancial but not to heavy body, light carbonation, very long hoppy bitter sweet aftertaste. A very complex and interesting beer definataly my favorite treehouse can

Melony piney hop aroma. Juicy melon and tropical fruit dominance spiked with some sharper hop edges and orange peel notes. Quite refreshing.

Notes: Can from brewery visit, Dec 16

16-oz can. Wow, thank you, N! We were supposed to be the ones thanking you today! Pours a cloudy bright medium orange amber with a dense and creamy off white head that sticks around for a while. Bright clear present forward green hoppy notes, absolutely like freshly mown hop flowers and vines or something. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Lightly toasted caramel under a steady wash of bright green hop notes, showing oranges, grapefruits, lemon zest, cheeba, and orange pith. Long tangy dry finish. Lovely beer.

Can. It pours an orange juice color with a foamy white head. The aroma is big with fresh juicy peaches, orange and mango. Very juicy and fresh. Hint of flowers and orange. The flavor is massive spicy orangy hops. Some peach and mango in the back. It has a creamy body that suggests a lot of flaked adjunct. Light malt. Very spicy and prickly hops in the finish, but Id call the bitterness only moderate to strong. Hop character is off the charts. Maybe a bit spicier than I like, but still top notch.

Bottle share @ Hampton Inn pre-DLD 2016. Pour is very hazy blonde with a medium white head that fades into foam. Notes of pineapple, guava, passion fruit, hop bitterness, dough, and dank tropical fruit.
Pours a hazy, light peach color with minimal head. Aroma full of tropical and citrus fruits. Flavor is slightly sweet, with mango, grapefruit, orange, bitter hops. Its really good.

Can, by way of a trade. 10 days old. Soupy, pale gold. Super sticky, dense, thin, white head. Nose is rich, sweet, juicy tropical fruits. Loads of pineapple, peach and pear. Some sweaty and dank, leafy hop. Hint of pine needle. Some mineral. Some stone fruit. Taste is juicy sweet, with some of that minerality. Light, hop leaf bitterness. Foamy, soft, juicy mouthfeel. Light, juicy bitter finish. Ridiculously drinkable.

Finally managed to score a can in a trade. Massive tropical fruits on the palate, mango, pineapple and citrus. Super juicy, fluffy mouthfeel. A nice smack of bitterness on the backend. Super great. Hype = justified

Can. Aroma of melon, bubblegum, orange sorbet, sweet pineapple, mango. 
Pours out thick glowing orange with a lasting white head. 
Taste follows the nose exceptionally with loads of complex juicy fruit, bubblegum and sweet orange. Fairly light bitterness on this one. 
Lighter side of full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, softer carbonation and a slightly pithy finish. 
In my mind one the most unique IPAs out there.

16oz can gotten by bananabi11 in a trade. Shared by all. Thanks! Unclear yellowish orange pour, a bit of a white head leaving spotty lace. Aroma has big citrus, oranges, other sour fruits. Great hoppy nose. Taste is oranges, grapefruit, light sweet toffee. Nicely tasty. Medium bodied. The blend is well done and the carbonation is constant. Finishes grapefruity bittersweet. This is indeed a juice hop bomb, and a showcase for the galaxy hop. 16
can pour from sills. aroma is dank and earhy. flavor is huge citrus and dankness. pours a slight hazy yellow with a white head. top 5 ipa i have ever had. need more.
Pours unfiltered hazy gold with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruit, tropical and resin. Taste is bitter with some light sweetness. Medium bodied, slick texture and fantastic overall.

Canette 473ml. Couleur orange foncé opaque, mousse beige pâle laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de mangue, houblon résineux, dank, pointe doignon qui se dissipe en saérant, cannabis, pamplemousse rose, malt subtil. Goût de houblon résineux, mangue, amertume moyenne-élevée persistante, malt, alcool, zeste de pamplemousse, à peine sucrée. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen-dense, texture ample.
Hazy yellow, huge head, yeasty aroma, grassy, fun, lemon, bitter, fruity, bitter flavor, lemony, fruity, grassy, fresh, excellent freshness, oniony, medium bodied.
Can. Color hazy yellow with white head. Aroma malt, grass, citrus, tangerine. Taste sweet, grass, pineaplle, tangerine, citrus, fruits, bitter aftertaste.

Aroma - Pineapple for days, candied orange peel. Appearance - Looks like pineapple juice, golden orange, turbid. Taste/ palate - Candied orange peel, tons of pineapple juice, passionfruit, grassy, a little herbaceous, bready malt, beautiful pillowy mouthfeel, medium-low rounded bitterness. Overall - Incredible IPA with tons of pineapple, herbaceous backbone, fairly dry and a rounded bitterness.

Pours super cloudy yellow with a fair amount of head, the aroma is fantastic. Pineapple, herbal tea, a little bit of popcorn, something like Brussels sprouts going on there, too... its complex. The flavor is tangy, bitter, a little bit sweet. The citrus thing is the dominant quality, but the finish is a long, lingering floral hoppy note that resonates for several seconds. This beer is damn fine.

At Trillium & Tree House tasting in Bruges, cheers Bart. Moussy, snow white, lacing, more or less stable head over a cloudy yellow blonde beer with lightly peachy hue. Complex and delicately fragrant bouquet of lime blossom, lemon peel, green kiwi, tangerine, pink pepper, green onion, mandarin flesh, damp marihuana, sweet red curry, unripe mango, green banana. Crisp, fruity onset, yellow kiwi, papaja, mangistan, spritzy carbo, lightly oily and supple mouthfeel, bready touch in the middle, supporting an utterly aromatic, rich hop finish, citrusy, spicy, bit resinous, with lots and lots of retronasal grapefruit, passion fruit and orange juice. Feels much more orange than green, so to speak, but by all standards another world class craft beer by this acclaimed IPA specialist.

16oz can. Pours a hazy yellowish burnt orange with a minuscule, quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is a dull, sweet blend of pineapple and mango with hints of grapefruit and resin. Taste is a watery blend of mango, melon, and guava that quickly dissolve into resiny, piney hops and bread. Finish is extremely quick and nothing really lingers. Very watery overall. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Thin, sticky, musty mouthfeel that is vaguely astringent.

Growler shared by jc1762. Thanks Jon! Poured a hazy dark yellow, light orange color with a small white head. Aroma was light zesty lime, grapefruit notes. Flavor was light sweetness, with a tasty light malt notes. Lots of zest, bitter. Delicious.

Growler into a glass showing hazy bright orange with half a finger of quickly dissipating white foam. 

The nose shows very dank and pithy grapefruit with juicy oranges. 

The palate is fully bodied and moderately carbonated. Impossibly juicy orange fruit profile throughout with a light zesty bitterness. Moderate zesty spiciness on the palate throughout.
Thank you Sharon! This baby pours a muddy orange with a great big soapy white head. Big citrus aromas and flavors. This is one great big hops bomb. A really terrific beer.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 Pours a muddy orange brown (rust?) with a soapy head. Not the prettiest beer. Nose is sweaty, musty hops, peach flesh, orange flesh. Mouth is pretty heavy, sweaty, and musty. Reminds me of King Julius. Some bitterness but the hops mostly add "dank-ness" here. I suspect some kind of fruit juice was added. This is pretty good and drinkable, but its so heavy and too fruit-forward, so its far from my favorite. Im recognizing this as the quintessential Tree House style.
Tasting at Eugenes, canCloudy blond color. Fresh hop flavor and aroma, but a bit too muddy. Nice.

16 oz. cam from Roger - thanks again, Roger! Pours a really hazy dull gold, like fruit juice, with a finger of soft foamy white head that takes forever to settle, finally into a ring, small island of film, and spots in the glass. It has a lot of the tropical fruits I expected, like pineapple and guava and tangerine. It also has some dank herbs in the aroma, with doughy malts - doughy in a way that suggests flour, even. Same for the flavor, giving it a bit of chalkiness to the texture. The flavor also has a bit more malt and fruity, resinous sweetness than the aroma, as well. Mango-melon. Medium-bodied, with soft, modest carbonation. A little sticky and a little dry on the finish. This is an excellent IPA but didnt quite stand up to the hype my pals had given it right before I opened this week-old can.

Tallboy can via Tired Hands line trade. Poured a New England style tea brown/gold body, super hazed, with a larger foamy white head. Aroma/flavor is super dank, tropical fruits, pineapple, guava, passion fruit, rotting citrus fruits, dough, rotting bread. Flavor is the same plus some green floral notes and more citrus towards the middle. Solid body, medium to fuller bodied, average long lingering carbonation and a slight burn on the aftertaste. Great beer.

My Bottom Line:
Dank, green and citrusy, this IPA offers everything you want when in need of raw, unabashed New World hoppiness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A thin veil of foam floats atop the very hazy blond.
-Aroma is very enticing.
-Mouthfeel is almost mealy, like freshly pressed orange juice. Works well for hop flavour, but doesnt let you perceive anything else.
-A slightly doughy foundation is tasted as well.
-This is very much in line with The Alchemist and Hill Farmstead-like IPAs.

Can.
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2016 quality ipa. thanks for the hookup, greg and alex. good hop aroma. complex taste and very drinkable. 2nd can a few days later. a little more plain. more yeasty tasting.

Appearance: opaque pale amber with two fingers of creamy ivory head, good retention and lacing. (4/5) Aroma: tropical fruit, tangerines, green grass, light resiny pine. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate bitter. (8/10) Medium body, moderate-soft carbonation, drying slightly sticky finish. (4/5)

An excellent example of Galaxy hopping, but in my opinion too restrained. I mean, OK, its not calling itself a DIPA the way Bright does, so I shouldnt be expecting that level of hop bomb goodness - but this, though hoppy, is positively polite, and really isnt sharply bitter like the commercial description claims. If the references are to be believed, this thing has a much higher IBU rating than Bright (90, versus Brights 75), but despite the forbidding opaque orange juice-like appearance, its soft-bodied and mild, bitter but not aggressive. Batch variations, maybe, but its not quite what I was expecting. I guess it boils down to me marking this down because its too easy to drink? (16/20)

Hazy fruit bomb! Small tan head, so much tropical fruit, pineapple, mango.
A big mouthfull, taste is pure fruit juice thought the taste is not as strong as the aroma. Strong pineapple in the taste
Can thanks to Nick. Pours hazy bright yellow with a medium white head. Notes of fresh new england dank hops, pineapple, melony, mango, citrussy, grassy. Nice!
Sample @ Blåbær 16. Hazy golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of juicy hops, citrusy, dank, sweet, stone fruit, mangoes and some light bitterness.
Happy IPA Day! Pours cloudy. Looks like pulp free OJ. Big clingy, lingering off white head. Aromas are vegital and citrus. Very citrusy. Orange and pineapple are the dominant flavors. Extremely good.

On can thanks to Nick at blåbær line 2016. Pours a hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Aroma has fresh, fruity hops, wheaty sweet malt base, citrus, new England fresh hops. Taste is medium sweet, leafy hop bitterness. Green is a very fitting name for this! Fluffy buddy and a High carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden with a creamy offwhite head. Aromas of floral hops, tropical fruits, citrus zest, caramel, resin and a light funky yeastness. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation. Deep malty and hoppy flavors into a stinging alcohol and hoppy bitter finish.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy amber beer with a small white head. Aroma is of hops, pine and citrics, especially orange and tangerine. Taste is medium bitter with soft carbonation. Smooth and with a hoppy astrigent aftertaste. Nice fruity and slightly alcoholic finish. The tangerine in the aroma and the taste is perfectly done.

Cloudy golden orange colour with big off-white head. Intense aroma of citrus, grass, flowers and herbs with hints of caramel. Fruity flavour on palate along with a touch of malty sweetness. Soft bitterness and slight peppery notes.

Déguestée en compagnie de Marc-André. Une IPA à la limite dêtre une IIPA qui ne fait aucunement les 7,5% dalcool quelle a en elle. Liquide jaune comme un soleil recouvert dune splendide couche de mousse blanche comme neige qui refuse de fondre. De toutes les beautés - comme le dirait si bien Marc Labrèche. Arômes fragiles de fruits tropicaux, dherbe, de pin, de fleurs de pommier, dananas et de mangue. Je dis fragiles car même en réchauffant, ces arômes ne sont pas envahissantes du tout; même loin de là. Lensemble est bien dosé, voire même discret. Une texture satinée comme le sont tous les produits de cette Maison si prisée. Jai limpression de boire la soie comme le dit si bien (et à raison) mon ami Marc-André. Des saveurs qui à linstar des arômes sont mi fruitées mi végétales. De lananas, de la mangue et du pin sans jamais au grand jamais laisser croire quil sagit dun liquide à 7,5% dalcool. Aucune amertume, que de laromatique. Se boit très aisément!

Can. The pour is a very hazy deep orange. The aroma is a blast of hops, all kinds of hops going on here. The taste is also a mouthful, almost chunky. Very solid offering here. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can shared at Belgian Chimipalooza, thanks! Cloudy straw with a white head. Aroma of big green hops, grassy and weedy. Flavour is moderate bitter. Light to light medium bodied with light carbonation.
Shared can at Todds. Hazy tropical IPA with some solid juicy notes. Really nice overall.
Taster from can in the line at DLD. Green is the perfect word to describe this one. Lots of dank hops. Medium bitterness. Damn good IPA.
Murky golden with a white creamy head. Powerfully fruity aroma, pineapple, peach, lemon. Very soft carbonation, easy to drink, deliciously fruity. Right on.

Can sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks Tom L. Cloudy blond with a white film. Fresh onion hoppiness with some rubber in the nose, sharp, bitter, oniony taste, but also notes of orange juice. Medium body, bitter, a little onion finish.

Appearance- hazy,unfiltered straw color
Aroma- profound grapefruit aroma
Taste- grapefruit beginning with hop finish
Overall- top 5 imperial IPA with delicious grapefruit and hop presence

Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma fresh pine and tropical fruits. Medium body with a little carbonation. Bitter flavors, herbal, pine, citrus, grassy, kind of rustic, long finish, excellent.
Hefig hopfiger, sehr frischer Antrunk. Geringe Herbe, intensiv grasig hopfig. Gut. 11/12/11/12/11/11

At a tasting, many thanks, small stable bubbly creamy head, extremely cloudy deep yellow color, strong onion aroma with some citrus and fruit behind. very strong dominant onion flavor with a bit of fruitiness creeping through and a mellow herbal bitterness, light bodied. Interesting and highly drinkable, just a bit one dimensional.

Can thanks to Alan. Pours a hazy yellow orange with medium creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit, mango and tangerine. Medium mouth, juicy, tropical dank, orange peel, light bitterness, very nice.

Can sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Amit. Canned 3/3/16, 9 days old. Murky yellow with a white head. Lovely hoppy aroma full of tropical fruits, a bit of citrus, and a light oniony note. Rather dry flavor, full of juicy tropical and citric fruits, a light oniony note, and moderate bitterness. Medium-bodied. Really good.

Can

Cloudy orange pour, with small white head. 

Heavier orange notes, with an impression of a maltier body. 

Lasting and full bodied orange flavour, with a smooth bitterness and a slightly sugary finish. 

Peppery on late finish.

16oz can: this one pours a hazy, opaque golden color. There was lots of head and some lacing. Good nose. Lots of citrus, pine and tropical notes. The taste is also very good. Suprisingly not overly bitter with a bit of sweetness. Tropical flavors, malts, touch of biscuit. Really Nice!

16 oz can shared with ebone1988. For this from Eddie the Tree House god. The pour is a light, bright orange juice with a thick collar of white head and a few strong spots of lace. Aside from the juice, this looks pretty good. The aroma is awesome. There is a ton of hops and bitterness. There is an excellent juiciness and a wonderful citrus. Just so juicy and hoppy. This should be magnificent. The flavor is SO juicy! There is an explosion of hops and citrus juice. This is absolutely magnificent. There is a heavy hop dominance and a strong juiciness. This is just awesome. It's one dimensional, but that's what I expect in an IPA. The mouth feel is a little thick and creamy with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly juicy hoppy aftertaste. This is a great IPA. I love this flavor. Just a little off on the back end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared with koleminer20 because hes awesome. Aroma is tropical fruit, pine, dank, pineapple, mango, juicy, wonderful. Appearance is amber golden, hazy, off white heard. Taste is juicy as fuck, tropical fruit, pine, some malt, dank, damn good. Mouthfeel is medium body, soft carbonation, lots of juicy tropical fruit and dankness in the aftertaste. Overall, once again Tree House fails to disappoint.
16oz can thanks to Steve. pours out a hazy straw peach color topped with a sand head. nose is big leafy hops caramel malty sweetness. Taste is more of the well rounded hop malt balance.

Smell strong smell of citrus, grapefruit, nectarine, melony hops! Light white head that stays with the beer. Light bitter taste with an aftertaste of earthy greenness. You can taste grapefruit zest. Literally tastes like youre drinking fresh hops! You are able to taste all the hops and flavors specifically! One of my favorites!
Can from Steve - thanks! Great aroma of citrus and a touch of pine/resin. Really great!

This is another staple in Tree Houses pretty insane lineup. Its got all of the things that Ive come to love and expect from a TH IPA -- extremely high hop aroma and flavor, essentially no bitterness at the end, and so much cloudiness that you cant see past the first inch of the stuff. I drink it right after Julius, and I honestly could only barely tell the two apart because my taste buds were so overwhelmed by the hops. Slightly less pure citrus hop flavor in this one, which allows more tropical notes from the Australian hops to come through. Wow.
Can. Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is Grapefruit and Tangerine. Taste is sweet orange grapefruit and tangerine with a hoppy grapefruit finish. Excellent.

500mL can, pours a cloudy golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out piney hops, biscuity malt and a little mineraly quality. Flavour is well-balanced, with a lot of piney hops and biscuity malt in good balance. Clean and thirst-quenching. Excellent.

16 oz can poured, thanks to Diceman. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a fizz ring head. Hop heavy aroma. Much more traditional of an IPA compared to my other experiences. Grassy hops, slightly vegetal. Lingering fruity hops. Tastes very "green". Not bad
Hazed gold, white head. Wow. Fragrant as hell. Juicy, tropical, melons, grassy, lightly bitter bit soft and fruity. What an amazing brew.

Sample thanks to Matt. Pours a hazy golden orange with a white head. Aromas of cantaloupe, tangerine, light pineapple. Juicy juicy. Taste is like tropical hop juice. Fairly thick and resinous mouthfeel. Very light bitterness. The melony flavors are a bit more subdued on this one than Julius but still comes through. I prefer Haze but this is great.

Can, huge thanks to Chris. Pours out a hazy, pulpy watered down orange juice color with a moderate white head. Pours murky orange golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of fresh hops, floral bitterness, citrus. Taste of mild bitter hops, green tea, citrus, very fresh, delicious!

Mise en canette le 22 décembre dernier. Un gros merci à Alex pour cette chance! Une robe jaune tellement ou trop embrouillée comme un jus naturel de fruits. Pours a completely clouded grapefruit juice color with a big, spongy head. Actually, this beer looks pretty neat in its own, headstrong, dirty way.

On the nose, a blend of resin and prickly lemon pulp creates the foundation of the aromas in this. An oat sweetness, together with a bready malt appeal provides a subtle, but well integrated balance, maintaining the focus almost entirely on the hops. Fruity lemon zest settles on top of this, blending into sweeter, not yet ripe, exotic fruits.

While not being too vivid on the carbonation, the mouthfeel completely soothes out any possible harshness from the profound hops, establishing an astonishing softness on the tongue, which tends to turn almost creamy during the finish.

Tastes of a soft aqueous quality up front, already establishing the beers gorgeous mouthfeel, with juicy lime cutting through in a very refreshing, playful way, allowing the flavor foundation to unfold its silkiness peaceable. Citrus blends into fruity, sweet sorbet, somewhere between woodruff jello, ripe orange and fresh cut grass in a cloudburst. Finishes with its already mentioned, yet defining, soft mouthfeel, mellowing all other flavors of the beer down to a minimum, only to invite a water melon accompanied hop dryness to the tongue, which lasts for decades.

Doubtlessly this beer is green. That is due to its unique sorbet-like middle part, as for its initial lime dryness and late grass dankness. These three flavors create a highly enjoyable synergy, guided by the world class mouthfeel in this, opening up the term softness to a whole new level. The more the beer warms up, the more obvious becomes its uncompromising hop onslaught, getting balanced by the beers smoothness instead of creating a malty backbone, preventing a hindering, hop decreasing sweetness.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Pours a hazy golden yellow from the can with fluffy off-white head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of big resinous citrus and grassy hop notes. Taste follows, huge and hoppy, but not overly bitter. Very nice, Vermont is making great IPAs.

Grass-fed butter notes blend in. Nettles and pineapple acidity in the very bitter but well-polished flavor. Green peppercorns, bits of salt, dried crispy herbs; generally aggressive, noisy spiciness. Texturally crisp initially, wet and juicy in the middle; ascendant mango sweetness nearing the finish, where the zinging acidity of citrus oils and tropical fruits eventually fades into a papery, greenish dryness. UPDATED: AUG 31, 2016 Fresh cans from the brewery, drunk August/September 2015.Fantastic pour shows plentiful white head atop a lightly hazy golden body. Good retention.Phenomenal amounts of tropical fruit in the nose, very juicy and enjoyable, with only light honey in the background, lightly balancing. Fortunately, theres not too much to balance, as its very, very low on the resin/pine/heavy citrus. Only a touch of grapefruit/lemon, but mostly pineapple and watermelon. Clean, lovely, no flaws/alcohol.In the mouth its more delightful tropical fruits, with a spicy element to it (not sure what hop thats from), some light caramel and a tight carbonation and supple malt body. A bit of citric bitterness/dryness builds up over the course of the can, and theres a little bit too much tanginess. As well, I could do without some of this caramel stickiness. But this is just nitpicking. By and large a fantastic, delicious beer.Canned 8/19/16, drunk 8/25/16.Maybe the best of the four we had from Tree House this night (Haze, Eureka Citra, Doppelganger and this).  Like Haze, its very much balanced by the maltiness and ultra-soft, fine carbonation, as well as the relative lack of resin/low bitterness.  Lovely galaxy-like spiciness lingers long on the finish, with tons of melon, pineapple and mango.  Like Haze, I can see it getting a bit too malty if one were to drink a few cans, and so in that vein, I vastly prefer the lower abv stuff like Eureka (and even Julius and its variants are lower in maltiness).  Almost no tanginess/pine/resin that I remember from the fresh cans I had prior to this, though those were also drunk one-two days old instead of six.  Regardless, still a fantastic beer and a true homage to the Galaxy hop.

Tree House Brewing out of Monson, Massachusetts seems to be the it brewery of the moment around here. Based on this beer alone I can see why, as its brewed very much in the New England-style IPA, which is trendy and popular now. I dont mind if a beer is trendy just as long as its good, and in the case of Green it most definitely is good (much more than good, actually).

I poured a 16oz can into a tulip glass. There was no freshness date. Thanks to Jason for the can!

Appearance: Pale orange hue over an extremely murky/opaque body. Looks like an Orange Julius. Pours to a large, white, frothy head which laces and retains tremendously.

Smell: Extremely clean, bright, fruity aroma  especially of pineapple and orange juice. A slight grassy/herbal note can be found, too.

Taste: There definitely is a difference between a highly-hopped beer and a beer thats hopped with finesse and style and this is a great example of that. The citrusy/tropical fruit aromas carry over to the palette perfectly. Almost sweet or even tart at first with pineapple and orange flavors. But its also significantly bitter. Juicy up front, but more grassy and herbal spiciness on the finish. The ability to make that transition is what separates the good IPAs from the great ones. Not much in the way of distinct malt character other than a general pale base. Thats okay, because the final product is so delicious and enjoyable I dont mind that its not perfectly balanced.

Drinkability: When I saw Tree House Green pouring out of the can I thought it looked like an orange milkshake. When I drank it, it thought it kind of felt like a milkshake, too. The body is so smooth and velvety  almost like a nitro stout. Though its certainly crisp on the backend, which makes it almost self-cleaning (the hops do linger on the tongue, though). At 7.5% ABV its certainly a strong beer, but in no way intimidating. I had to hold myself back from slugging it all down at once. 

Score: 10/10

Bottle shared at Borefts beer fest day 2 27/09/2014. Bodegraven. Many thanks to Mike Morse. Hazed golden yellow coloured pour with ano head. Aroma is nice green hop, pine, hop leaf, fresh, little grassy. Flavour is composed of spicy hop leaf, orange rind, bit grassy. Palate is medium full , little sticky, lowish carbonation . Decent.

Growler... Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a light head. Aroma is citrus based with pineapple and tangerine smells. Taste is light sweetness with medium bitterness. This is one of the best IPAs I have ever had. Very close in quality to Julius from Tree House. I hope to have Green many times in my days! Delicious!!!

Bottle 750ml. w. swing top @ 6th Borefts Beer Festival 2014. [ As Tree House Green ].[ Courtesy of Mike Morse ]. Hazy medium golden amber yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, straw - grass, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, herbs, fruity hops, zest. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity, orange - mandarin, zest, herbal, straw - grass. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140927]

27th September 2014Borefts VI. Day 2. Growler thanks to Mike Morse. Lightly hazy gold - amber beer, tiny white head. Palate is light and dry with mild fine carbonation. Light dry malts, light floralness. Tangy orsnge citrus, little marmalade. Tangerine peel. Light semi dry finish. Peel linger. Tasty but too dry.
Growler at Borefts 7.5% hazy gold colour. Tea leafy fresh hop tasting ipa. Rather amazing. Dry. Good. Excellent

Growler thanks to WillRunForBeer! Cloudy amber pour with a big foamy head that fade slowly to a nice film and leaves great lacing. Love the appearance. Awesome, complex, fruity and slightly dank aroma, can smell from a foot away. Juicy peaches, oranges, mango, grapefruit, apricots, and pineapple. Tastes has a nice balance of light sweetness and light bitterness. Juicy at first with mostly apricot and orange juice. Mostly peach-y in the finish with grass and light herbal spice. Medium to full body. High carbonation but gives a very soft mouthfeel. Even though the body is thick for an IPA this is super crushable. Awesome beer. Could use a touch more bitterness but Im being very picky.

Growler... Pours clear and amber with a white head. The bouquet displays stern, fruity notes of pineapple, orange, grapefruit and passionfruit. Full-bodied and fatty with dancing carbonation. The flavor furnishes loads of both citrus and tropical fruit rinds and peels. Crisp, snappy, grassy finale. Growler courtesy of ctipping!

Bottle shared at BBF 14, 27/09/14, big thanks to Mike Morse.
Lightly hazed golden with moderate off white spotting and edgework.
Nose is skunky hoppage, citric pith, mandarin, straw.
Taste comprises more skunky hop tones, mandarin, bitter apricot, straw, light spice, citric pithdom.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a hoppy wash.
Decent IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler filled today. Pours a cloudy, nearly opaque glowing orange with very small white head. Aroma is insanely juicy mango, lychee, candied grapefruit, peach, apricot nectar, cotton candy, light pine. Taste is orange mango passionfruit juice with a hop presence that initially seems to have very low bitterness and then dries out the mouth. Slight booziness in both the aroma and flavor. Creamy texture. In the upper echelon of American IPAs, right up there with the creations of Mr. Hill.

Bottle/Growler at BBF14 - kindly shared by Mike Morse - cheers!. Pours clear yellow with a hay coloured hue. Nose is exotic fruits à la mango, pineapple and bits of melon. A tad greenish in the back as well. Very nice IPA, drinkeable as hell.

Growler shared @ Borefts thanks to Mike. Pale yellow, decent white head. Aroma is passionfruit, citrus, pot, spruce. Light bodied, lightly bitter on the palate with a fruity, juicy finish. Taste is passionfruit, mango, pawpaw, spruce, orange blossom

Pours fuzzy yellow / orange . Small white head . 
Smell is bitter , very herbal . 
Taste is bitter , green , bit malty . 
OK .
Bottle at de molen 2014... Dry zezty lime fry... Juicy sweet fruits dry... Bitter herbal fruits... Long lime zezty orange

Poured from a 1 pint bottle into a Treehouse Brewing stemmed glass.

The color is a deep yellow gold with two fingers of pillowy white head and some really nice lacing left on the glass.

The smell is fruity with a grapefruit aroma and a juicy fruit gun smell there as well. A leafy/fresh cut grass aroma tickles the nose a bit.

The taste has a sweet juicy citrus flavor that is like biting into a tangerine rubbed with hop resin. A tangy fruit flavor with a sticky bitterness that bites but levels out toward the middle lets the passion-fruit flavor and ruby red grapefruit flavor come out.

The feel of this beer is lighter then expected for a 7% IPA. The bitterness has a way of growing and a nice smoothness instead of being abrasive. The great drinkable feel of this beer is delightful and packs a whole lot of flavor into this well crafted IPA.

Growler shared by a friend. Cloudy orange pour with a thick off-white head. Aroma of big tropical fruit, apricot and sweet malt. Malty and tropical fruit flavor with resinousness before a fruity finish.

Poured from growler into tulip: Pours hazy golden with a thick white head. Aroma is heavy on grapefruit and pineapple. Taste is a little sweeter than I expected. This is like drinking a fruit smoothie. Very taste, tons of pineapple and other fruit. Medium body, a little sticky, little sweeter than I would have liked but its pretty awesome still.

Sampled at Julios Spring Beer Fest. Yellow/gold pour with a white head. As advertised, a ton of citrus on the aroma. Lots of orange/tangerine flavor with sharp, bitter bite. God, can these people make a beer that isnt outstanding. Wished I lived anywhere near them.
Cloudy faded yellow piney grapefruit bubblegum phenols fairly gnarly bristly bitter. Light tang.
Sampled during Julios Spring Beer Fest. Great IPA, in fact everything this brewer offered was outstanding. Looking forward to drinking more of their brews.
Taster at Julios Beer Fest. Pours pale yellow gold with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, pine. Juicy up front, leading to a grassy bitterness in the finish.

Pours thick lemon in color with a white head. Aroma brings pleasantly sweet lemon lime notes. Flavor brings tart lime citrus notes not overbearing with a great balance and dryness ending so well on the palate.

25.4 oz growler, a week old. Cloudy orange brown with a white head and lacy spots. Nose is orange, mango, musk, toffee and pine. Resiny, medium to full body with a tingle. Taste is lemon candy, eucalyptus, grass and pine with herbal hints. Finishes with grapefruit peel and white pepper.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 As has been said this IPA is fantastic. Huge citrus aroma; incredible long-lasting bitter flavor. Balance where needed. Wow.

This has improved and is world-class.  Im sure a better IPA will exist, but it doesnt now.

This might be the best IPA I have ever had. It was shared with me at a christmas party last night. They are moving the brewery to a new location that is 10mins from my house, and I couldnt be more excited. There is tons of citrus in the aroma. The flavors are grapefruit and sweet pine. This beer is heavy, but the soft carbonation balances it out perfectly. We killed this one bottle, and I could drink this all night. The bitter hops are not harsh. I have 2 growlers that need a refill very soon ( next Thursday.)
Growler. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Citrusy hop aromas. The taste follows suit. Good balance with a sturdy caramel malt backbone. Good body and mouthfeel. Well done..

Growler. Pours a light golden with a low head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is of pine and grass (dank). Taste is indeed hoppy, Id say that it was moderately bitter but there was also a good amount of sweetness (not disturbing). Carbonation was really good and maybe even a little high for a growler (I think this was 2 weeks old, I was kind of impressed). Body was medium but it felt lighter than that. I never expected for it to be this good! Nice!

growler. pours hazy light golden with a nice small white cap, good retention and lacing. spicy and juicy mangoes, dankness, citrus, hint of tropical, slightly buttery, honeyed sweet maltiness, some grass and pepper. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily and thick, nice spicy-citrusy finish. tad unbalanced but very enjoyable nonetheless.
Le sapinage est furieux mais aussitôt ramolli par les agrumes, hyper aromatique, juteux et résineux. Élégante conception, rien à envier aux meilleures ipa.

Growler (750 ml). Two weeks old. From Ernesto, thanks! Clear golden with a small white head and good lacing. Nice aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, dank hops and resinous notes. Taste is also of tropical fruits and citrus along with dank hops, moderate sweetness, nice malt backbone, resinous presence and light to moderate bitter finish. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Well balanced and super drinkable. Reminds me of the good IPAs from Hill Farmstead. Excellent!

Growler big thanks to Melissa for bringing this one down! Beautiful peach colored pour. Nose and flavor are rife with big apricot, peach, dank weed, spruce, mango. Good sweetness, drinkable for 8%. Reminds me of a cross between Abner and that crazy triple IPA from Tired Hands that Im too lazy to look up. Sweet and not too bitter, but drinkable. Good stuff.
Draft. Fruity nelson sauvin esque hoppy notes, relatively light bitterness, medium malty sweetness, and some lingering tropical fruits. Good stuff.

Clear orange body, large off-white head, soapy lacing. Nose is straight pineapple and tangerine with hints of resing and pine. Flavor opens up with an intense melon hop character and some sticky-sweet malts. Medium bodied with appropriate carbonation, and assertive bitterness. Only knock is it could be a little bit drier.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 750ml growler in a tulip. Pours hazy amber/copper with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma strong of floral and fruity hops with light citrusy notes, a nice light maltiness, and some dough. Flavor strong of the fruity and citrusy hops. Average texture. A good IPA.
EDIT 4/7/14: 750ml growler in a teku.  Same appearance.  Still has lots of fruity and citrusy hops.  Nice.
EDIT 11/2015: big can.  This beer is phenomenal.  4 to 4.2

Another great IPA from Tree House. Full of juciy hops with a lot of orange and orange peel bitterness. Moderately sweet with a little bit of a syrupy malty sweetness that balances the high bittering. Love it.

Clear orange tinged with gold, moderate white head. Burst of juicy tropical fruits: mango, pineapple, peach, grapefruit, and orange. I can savor this aroma for days. Bitter and sweet flavors blend together to hit the tongue simultaneously, leaving a crisp, refreshing finish that gives very little indication of the alcohol content. Smooth, almost light-bodied, and softly carbonated.

Thanks Reynolds! Pours a medium golden color with a finger of eggshell foam and great clarity. The nose is big and juicy with lots of honeydew melon, mango, citrus, pineapple, touch of boozy pine and a clean malt background. The palate follows the nose nicely with tons of tropical fruit, a bit of earthy pine and a sweet malt backbone. Big bitter melon rind moves in towards the later part of the palate and cleans up the full round mouthfeel on the finish. Pretty delicious.
Wow this is great, huge citrus flavors with a sweet body. Tons of crystal malts, delicious

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 5 day old Growler from Alan, pours hazy orange with medium white head. Heavy mango, pineapple, papaya, guava, sticky malt, and light sugar. Liked it a lot, but slightly too sweet. Should be an imperial?

Pours a hazy orange/yellow with a creamy medium white head. great retention and heavy lacing. aroma has nice fresh floral notes...green...nice orange and tangerine, some rind and a touch of melon. flavor has nice bitter rindiness with grapefruit, tangerine, light grass and spice...very floral and hoppy. mouthfeel is medium and silky with a dry citrus rind bitter finish. just awesome.

Pours a hazy light orange with a fluffy white head. Huge citrus aroma of orange and grapefruit with tropical fruits like pineapple and papaya. Initially sweet with a bitter finish. Light in body. Growler from brewery on 8/31
